pageContext.desc: Daily life of a well-to-do family in Louisville.
transcription:
Saturday, January 1, 1859
Belle has her first two new lower teeth through - and 4 first permanent back teeth through -
[circled in middle of page]
Belle was born September 25 - 1851
7 years, 3 months old 1/1/59
ASB 8/25/31

January  Monday 3  1859
Went at 10 1/2 Oclock A.M. (in a Hack) with Sis + Virg + the 2 children and called on W Craikâ€™s family, also on Mrs. Zane.

January TUESDAY 4 1859
In afternoon, went to unclear in 1st unclear unclear.
In evening, went to Theater to see The Children of the Cyprus with Mother Badger, Aunt Elizabeth, Mrs. Hilton, Ella Eadin Horace Belle + Eva Mrs. Hilton 2 children W. unclear Shreve David + Mr. Badger.

January WEDNESDAY 5 1859
Made calls today on Dr. Ewings Mrs. Eakins Mr. Brishullo + Breeden, Mr. Christian Miss Leighs Mrs. Hamilton Mrs. Caldwell Mr. Danforth Mrs Adams

January THURSDAY 6 1859
Weather rainy. Went to Auction of France's household Faulds? with Mr + Mrs Shreve Mrs. Faulds + Bella - bought nothing but some rings for Muffins -

January FRIDAY 7 1859
Went at 11 A.M. to Dr. Marcus, had my teeth fixed.
In evening, went to Theater with Octavia + W. Badger
saw Mrs. Julia Dean Hayne as Adrienne.

January WEDNESDAY 12 1859
Had quite a hard day's work to fix the children for M. Wastels Ball. Went about 7 o clock P.M. Unclear are? unclear. Belle + Eva dressed in white satin + pink tunics? spangled.
Mr. Jacob + Miss Ana Martin married tonight could not go to party.

Sunday, January 16, 1859
Visited Ma in Morning
- - - Mrs. Hilton Afternoon
Mrs. Badger Afternoon

Monday, January 17, 1859
Dancing school met here. Mrs. Wastell has commenced a new dance with the children, (Air Come over the Summer Sea). Sis took lunch with me.

Tuesday, January 18, 1859
Children spent the day at Grandma Badger's. I went visiting with Mrs. Hilton - called to see Mrs. J.B. Alexender - Mrs. Geo. Merriweather, R. Tyler, Mrs. C. Johnson, Mrs. Kealrley Carter, Mrs. Willa Stokes, Mrs. Tom Masters, Mrs. C. Jacobs, Mrs. Joe Morris, Mrs. Sam Craik, Mrs. Barbridge, Mrs.Small, Mrs. H. Morton, Mrs. unclear, Mrs. Hopkins.
- Morgan Coleman - Mrs. L. V Badger, Mrs. Cutts, Mrs. Dr. Marshall called on me.

Wednesday, January 19, 1859
Sent children down town to walk this morning - 
Went visiting with Benjamin + Siss at twelve o'clock, returned at 4 o'clock. Called on Mrs. Bush, Mrs. T? Hatt, Mrs. Charles Ripley, Mrs. Wm Garsin & E. Garsin, Mrs. Shepherd & Miss? Morris, Mrs. Benedict & Garett, Mrs. Tom Hirst?, W.H. Pofsa. Today is most beautiful. Went at 5 o'clock to Father Badger's to spend the evening with all the children, Mrs. Hilton's family there. Returned hone at half past nine. Finished children's blue Hoods -
,

[Printed diary heading: January THURSDAY 20 1859]
this is a wet day - we were going to visit but cannot now - I will go with V + Siss to shop - children went to Siss, had to stay an hour on account of rain
Dancing school meets here this Afternoon at three
Paid to day Mrs Murphy, a bill, Martin and Pentons - also Mr Herz

[Printed Diary Heading: January FRIDAY 21 1859]
Cold morning - threatens snow Siss and V called to see me I promised to ride with them this afternoon - Siss gave me some nice dark blue ribbon for children Hoods and edging for baby shirt. Paul ? ten dollars Siss did, (the same from she ? me-. I paid for her at Danville Went to see Mrs Southall this Afternoon - engaged her to come when I send for her - V + Siss with me -
Went to night to Paroohi? Concert - much pleased - David and Mr Shreve were present

[Printed Diary Heading: January SATURDAY 22 1859]
Clear + very cold - children went to see Aunt Belle found her out.
Belle spent the Afternoon with Aunt Belle. Mary Shreve spent the morning with me - Ada Camille two years old this morning at nine O clock - she has neither eye or stomach teeth through yet - but stout + hearty - and can talk clear + distinctly everything -

[Printed Diary Heading: January SUNDAY 23 1859]
Clear + cold - Belle went to sunday school at nine - Mr. Badger to Church - dined with Ma 
came home at five
wrote a letter to Joe - Mr. L. V. Badger + Octavius spent the evening with me -. all went to night Church except me -

[Printed Diary Heading: January MONDAY 24 1859]
Beautiful day Clear and not very cold. Children all went out to walk untill two O clock 
at three went to Mrs. Adams to dancing school - at four I went to ride with Siss + Virginia had dinner at five and at seven went with David, Mrs. Badger and children to hear the Swiss Bell singers (the Peak Family) - children much pleased - (I thought it poor- Ada has new shoes to day - Met Mrs. Hilton at children at Concert.

[Printed Diary Heading: January TUESDAY 25 1859]
Clear + mild weather - Children walked out all morning. Mrs. Morgan Coleman + Mrs. Henry ? called to see me had lunch at one - sent children out to walk after lunch - then put on my bonnet and called to see the Nock family and made a long call - returned home late and found Siss + Mr. Shreve in the parlour. Came to ? with me - Spent a pleasant evening
David also took time? with me - sent regard to Annie Wiesagers? party by Virginia -

[Printed Diary Heading: January WEDNESDAY 26 1859]
Ada received a new pair of Mitts from Grandma Sheridan, Children went this morning to see Grandma Badger - Annie Grant? + I went to the Office then returned at 2 O'clock
called on Mrs. Powell - then dressed children for Peak Swiss Bell ringers, Ada Mary? & Ellen went together - cost for 2 servants 80cts - after they went to Concert - Belle + Eva with David V. Mathis + Jamie. Siss called for me to dine with her - which I did. After dinner called to see Mrs. Page first time Mother for 4 years? has gone any? when to sit up - went after Ten to Opera of Lucretia Paredi? - it was grand -

[Printed Diary Heading: January THURSDAY 27 1859]
Warm but rainy - sent Ellen to inquire After Mrs. Page. found her better - I sent her Blanc Mango?, she sent me Blackberry Pie - at twelve O clock Siss promised to come + dine, but it rained hard and she declined - I went + took the three children and spent the day with her - returned home at Six - went to see Virginia who had sick Headache. fell down in Ally - got hands and knees muddy. but did not hurt myself. Ma scalded her hand with hot Coffee. not badly - went to Opera of Prariala? took Belle - rode in Carriage with Haittro?
sentence written down the right side children did not go to Grants dancing school to day

[Printed Diary Heading: January FRIDAY 28 1859]
Still warm + Sunny - children out walking - I engaged at sewing Machine. Miss Warner + Mrs Caldwell called to see me - Mr. Ben Adams went to New Orleans this Afternoon. so did Annie Martin Ms Jacobs - + Judy Nicholas 
Belle + Eva dined with Ma and then at three with Siss cut Belles Hair + Eva's too - Went to Opera with Siss + Virginia in Carriage. heard Lucia Di Lammermoor
full house - Madam Nichirst? + Squires very good -

[Printed Diary Heading: January Saturday 29 1859]
Sunshiny + little cool - children as usual out walking
at three went to dancing school with my trio - my full house - Belle + Eva danced the Gavotte + Schotch reel - Siss spent a few minutes with me after I got home - Eva commenced wearing? a comb to day for the first time
Attended Opera to night of Il Trovatore  - full house Virginia + David present - also Mary Shreve + Octavius 
Nancy Dick with Sore throat -

[Printed Diary Heading: January SUNDAY 30 1859]
Sunny but cool - Belle attended sunday school also Mr. Haywoods church with her Father. Eva + Ada are now going to Grandma [Badgers crossed out] Sheridans to sit an hour - Ma made us all dine with her - which was very pleasant
at four O clock returned home put on bonnet and called to see Grandma Badger - spent a very pleasant few hours - returned home at six - called to see Mrs. Southall - found her out - Went to Mr. Haywoods church after Tea -

[Printed: January MONDAY 31 1859]
Clear + Sunny - as usual children out walking - went? the Virginia at eleven to ride called to see Mrs. Southall - found her home - called also to see Mr. Mc Donald at Mrs. Osborns - Children went to Mrs. Grant? to dancing school - Mrs. Harthings? borrowed childrens Aprons and sent her duly? around ? Belles wax doll Annie Hint? had her hair shined off - bought Ice Cream + cakes and sent to Delly Page

[Printed: February TUESDAY 1  1859]
Went to bed at twelve O clock
lay thinking untill one. had several pains - thought perhaps it was colic - got Mr B. to give me some Soda - did no good - told him they were sure ? pains, Sent for Mr. Southall and Dr. Rogers, Ma, + Virginia came over, pains very slow and not bad - at 12 O clock in the day - a fine son came to town just got fixed in Bed when Mrs. Haggins? took Mrs. D. away
Ma stayed with me untill ten in evening - Pa took a Hack and went for Mrs. Hackney - did not sleep all night - baby wakeful --

[Printed: February WEDNESDAY 2  1859]
did not sleep all night
felt bad this morning
have had much pain Ma took children home with her a number of Friends inquiring how I am - weather very warm and Sunny
children all well and very good - Virginia + Siss called to see me - Ma comes over every morning - servants keeping house very nicely -

[Printed: February THURSDAY 3  1859]
Slept a little last night felt better this morning - this is my third day - expecting a Fever? from milk - have it with every chill? - Virginia + Siss called and stay with me untill 12 - a few minutes after they left had a chill for 15 minutes then Fever Shivered untill 11 O clock - no sleep at all - I have plenty of milk - children have all kept pretty well - Sisters are very kind - they come to see me often

[pencil scribbled all over the page]
[Printed: February FRIDAY 4 1859]
Spent a very bad night
did not sleep - truly quite cross - 
Mrs. Hackney hey visited?
Mr. Badger slept in room with children
Kate Winston had a daughter this morning named Mary

[Printed: February SATURDAY 5  1859]
It is snowing very fast
Snowing all day - dont feel at all comfortable have as uncomfortable hend? all the time
my eyes hurt me very much - Ma is very kind, sends me a great many nice things - so does Siss + Virginia. My little ones behave very nicely - Mrs. Hackney is very kind but doesnt like to work - servants have to do everything
Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium children and servants went in Virginia Carriage to see the Old Folks

[Printed: February SUNDAY 6  1859]
The children were much pleased with the concert of the Old Folks - Ada went too - she is 2 years old - took a Hyuicand? Pill - slept tolerably well
Mrs. Hilton called to see me
I had a severe Headache and talking so much with her made it worse - but I always enjoy so much her visits. Mr. L. V. Badger, Ella + Eddie, Mr. Badger and Belle went to Church - did not sleep at all to day - Mr. Hackney went to church -

[Printed: February MONDAY 7  1859]
Did not sleep well last night
baby cried a great deal
I think I feel better to day - Belle + Eda gone to old Mammy H. Grants funeral (a colored woman) then they walked down to buy Cakes
Mrs. Badger called and stayed sometime - It is quite cold - but clear - with some snow
I have had a severe pain in my right side
Mrs. Alex Craig's baby was born this morning it is a little girl -

[Printed: February TUESDAY 8  1859]
I did not rest well last night - am unfortunate in that particular - when sick
Mrs. Ben Adams left for the South (Havanna) to day - also Mrs. L. Shreve's party - Mary Shreve too gave Mrs. Hackney a gray flannel - sack for herself - I cut out in Bed two cotton ducks for myself - baby had a violent colic last night did not sleep at all - Mrs. Hackney gave him Brandy -

[Printed: February WEDNESDAY 9  1859]
I feel nicely this Morning
it is a bright clear morning - my two little girls have gone to singing school at Grandma Sheridan
Mr. Whiffle is their teacher. Also Alex Craigs baby was born on the seventh - a daughter
Mrs. Brent sent baby a net worsted cap, and Matthia Fandols? a pair of white Merino shoes
Siss gave children spotted collars and sleeves - after Tea played Cards with children, Mr. Badger gone home.

[Printed: February THURSDAY 10  1859]
Ma came to see me this morning
I feel very nice to day - yesterday was my ninth day - children out walking - Siss sent me  nice dinner - Virginia came to see me to day
children gone to Judge Nicholas' to dancing school at three O clock
Dr. Bagers left me to day in the charge of my Nurse - he has been very attentive - have taken no medicine but citrate of Lemonade - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium -

[Printed: February FRIDAY 11  1859]
Ground covered with snow
feel very well to day but have promised not to get up for some days children gone to Grandma's to Singing school - Mrs. Christ, Holly Johnson + Mrs. W. P. Johnston. called to see me - Mrs. H. Christy's reception day on Monday - Siss also same to see me - and bought a box of Prunes - Mr. Badger gone to Lecture and then Home - gave Nancy five cents Eva ten cents bought 4 yards of white flannel - 2 cents of gray - and 3 yrd white Cotton

[Printed: February SATURDAY 12  1859]
It looks like snow - Miss Rebecca sent to inquire after me - feel very well to day - instead of getting up on the tenth I intend to wait. Ma called this morning - Mrs. A. D. Grant called
children gone with Mrs. Hackney to Artic Regions
cost 45 cts Pa a ticket 25 cts
Siss called to see me she almost fainted - not at all well - put up blue curtains to day - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium
Siss Page sent me a nice Pin Cushion made of swiss worked with red -

[Printed: February SUNDAY 13  1859]
Belle received a Valentine saturday night - she was delighted - Mr. Badger and Belle gone to church
I am sitting up to day for first time
Siss Virginia - and old Mr. Badger called also Mrs. Badger + Aunt Cutts - Annie Grant came to see baby - David came also 
Mr. Badger gone to his sisters - Mr. Badger is going to Mr, Haywoods church to night
Mr. Badger going to Tea at Siss's

[Printed: February MONDAY 14  1859]
It looks very much like rain - Miss Rebecca came to see me - Siss sent me Bananas + Wafers - sitting up to day - children gone to buy Valentines
I gave Belle 20cts Eve 15cts
Ellen bought a pretty valentine for Ada to give ? - Belle sent Valentine to? Lizzie Hunt, Charlie Adams Crafton? Durall Mallie Fanlds? + Alice Hilton, Eva sent to Annie Hunt, Carrie Adams Mattie Sheridan + Horace - Belle + Eva received many Valentines
They gave a Boquet - Dancing school met here this Afternoon, Mrs. Powell called to see me

[Printed: February TUESDAY 15  1859]
It rained all night, is still raining children at home did not feel well this morning. children still getting Valentines - my baby 2 weeks old - Virginia has taken children to ride she sent me Oranges. Siss came to see me
still pouring rain. Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium
it is lightening + Thundering severely baby has taken cold - sniffles and cant sleep well - Ma sent Brother a made coloured? Cloak lined with blue flannel to wrap him in at night

[Printed: February WEDNESDAY 16  1859]
It is very damp but sunny
children gone to Virginia to singing school - Mrs. Grant sent to inquire after me - Siss sent me two birds
Siss + Virginia both called 
Eva has come home sick vomited? her - in two hours she was better - Siss and? Brother a very handsome flannel skirt
with? white Merino ??? embroidered
Mr. Badger gone out he brought home a can of oysters, little children playing Cards my 2 year old child the first child I ever seen gives me trouble?

[Printed: February THURSDAY 17  1859]
Raining this morning - Eva still sick - her Fever so high that I sent for Dr. Rogers - Dancing school meets here this Afternoon - Eva much better now - still pouring rain - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium. Eva got another Valentine
she also got a Paint Box. Mr. Badger brought home another Can of Oysters. Baby's cold better, I spend very sleepless nights. never with any of my children spent pleasant nights - cant sleep in days

[Printed: February FRIDAY 18  1859]
Dr. Rogers called to see Eva. her Chill + Fever came on at twelve O clock
Belle gone to Virginias to dancing school - it still rains and is very damp - children got three Valentines to day. ? not received Lucy Curds? wedding ticket. Eva worse at 2' O clock. had to send for the Doctor - he says she has severe cold + sore throat. Siss stayed sometime with me. received a letter from ?oe?. Siss sent me Egg, kisses
Mr. Badger sent me beautiful Bananas. Mr. B. gone to church

[Printed: February SATURDAY 19  1859]
It is sunny but raining
Ma sent baby a drab merino cloak lined with flannel
I am dressed to day and feel better - Eva better to day her cold spell has not returned - Siss came to me I walked into front room - first time for 2 weeks. Mr. Hackney gone down town Mrs. Brent came to see me so did V + David
Siss sent me Peaches Mr. Badger gone to Ma, to Tea, then to Gymnasium. he thinks old Granny + noisy children not agreeable. I poor thing must endure it all. Ma sends me good things every day -

[Printed: February SUNDAY 20  1859]
I am pretty well to day - still in my night Gown - all my children well - Mr. Badger gone down town - returned home and he + Belle went to church
clear, sunny + cold - Mr. Badger gone to night to Church - Mr. Hackney too. Mr. B. gone to see his relations. children out walking
Siss sent me Cus tard - + Oranges

[Printed: February MONDAY 21  1859]
Sunny + beautiful - all well
children out walking
Dancing school meet at 3 at Mr. Ben Adams - Fanny Wards Mother died on 19 - at 2 O clock - she leaves 2 little ones - children went with their Father to see River which is very high - Mrs. Clar? Lewis Mrs. John White Mrs. Dr. Marshall called to day
Mrs. Hiltons French Sophia brought the children round
Mary Rhanugriel? - Eliza Nock + Willis called. also Siss Virginia Mattie + Jamie
Siss sent me nice jelly + wafers
Mr. Badger brought me nice Apples Prunes + bananas

[Printed: February TUESDAY 22  1859]
This is a lovely morning some talk of a Parade children gone to see River again. V. + Siss came to see me they going visiting Mr. Hayden Curd
All? to day Lucy Curds wedding Postponed - all of Pock jaw?
Mrs. J. B. Holt called also Mrs. Eakes Mrs. Hopkins Mrs. Duffield Ella Badger Mrs. Dr. Powell Mrs. Hilston, Dr. Powell's daughter came from Virginia on 19 - Mr. Badger gone to River with Mrs. Hilton - after Tea
Mr. Brent to Gymnasium and to see his Mother + Siss. I feel pretty well to day. tired from talking too much -

[Printed: February WEDNESDAY 23  1859]
Looks like rain - children gone to Virginia's to Singing school - Ada to walk. Lea Duffield spent an hour here
Sue Adams + Mary Rainbridy? came to see baby. Mrs. Selina Lawrence Churchill died this morning at 5 - O clock - in 1? month her infant 3 months old - received a letter from New York from Rhoda? Mr. Badger gone to Ma's to Tea - all of us well -

[Printed: February THURSDAY 24  1859]
Still threatens rain. My little ones out playing
Mrs. John Churchill busied this morning morning from Christ Church  Virginia came to see so did Mrs. Chad Tucker - Ella Badger dined with us - Mr. Curd died this morning - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium
Dancing school met at Mr. Beu Adams to day - we all in health to day

[Printed: February FRIDAY 25  1859]
It rained all night - look like it would to day - Piccolomini is to sing to night I hope to go. lent Mrs. Hackney 25cts Virginia + Siss called to day - children out walking
Siss Page called - Susy Adams brought me a Boquet of flowers - it rains to night [to night repeated and crossed out] but I intend to Venture to Concert - rode in Virginia's Carriage. little Pic is beautiful + fascinating crowded house she was dressed in blue flowered silk with Opera Cap of Blue - very pretty

[Printed: February SATURDAY 26  1859]
Beautiful + Sunny. all well
think some of seeing little Pic to night Mr. Curd to be buried to day at half past two - Virginia came at 3 to take me to ride
I enjoyed it very much
it did not make me sick. bought Cake Candy for children - Mrs. Hilton called. Mr. Badger has gone to see Pic. I did not. Ma thought I better not. I am now long 9? did not. it was 10? fine.

[Printed: February SUNDAY 27  1859]
Beautiful + sunny Mr. Badger + Belle gone to Church. Mrs. Hackney too Siss came to see me John Hilton came to see baby - I went down to dinner for first time to day after dinner went over to see Ma. stayed a long time  Belle gone to dine with Aunt Belle. Mr. Badger gone to see his sister - after Tea he went to Church - John Hilton stayed a long time -

[Printed: February MONDAY 28  1859]
Bright + Sunny as spring

[Printed: March  TUESDAY 15  1859]
Beautiful Morning - gave Belle a dime to buy Jacks with and Eva twenty cents for a Ball
Ada five cents for Cakes
white worsted twenty five cents - gave Robert ten cents - went Shopping with Virginia + Siss - recieved card James Stokes wedding
made Spring purchases

[Printed: March  WEDNESDAY 16  1859]
Weather beautiful - children gone to singing school - Grandpa taken Ada to his house (Badger) - Belle, Eva + Ada gone at 3'O clock to dancing school at the Hall - Elle Badger came to see me - also Mrs. Hutchings and her children came to see me. Mr. Badger gone to Ma's house to supper -

[Printed: March  THURSDAY 17  1859]
Raining - children all at home - dancing school met here
Ada Tyler borrowed Eva's Aprons - Mr. Badger gone Gymnasium

[Printed: March  FRIDAY 18  1859]
Snowed and rained all day - finished childrens dark calico dresses - Mr. B. at home cutting out the childrens paper Furniture - at night my little girl I lost was 14 months old - her name was Mary Virginia - she was my only dark eyed one, her eyes were dark brown 
fair skin + Brown Hair lovely features - every one thought her beautiful - I certainly did - she never walked - but could stand by anything - and talk some - she died of whooping cough - in June, she was lovely

[Printed: March  SATURDAY 19  1859]
Clear + cold - children gone to dancing school
Virginia called to see me - making childrens white flannel dresses of swiss - Mary Craiks or Mrs Cassidy) baby born on Thursday the 17 - Siss came to see me - Mr. B. gone to Gymnasium - children gone to Caft Colemans

[Printed: March  SUNDAY 20  1859]
Sunny + pleasant - went to church - at Mr. Craiks
took children with me
Mr. B. went to his church - I went with Mr. B to his church at night - his Father and Octavius, Eddie - supped with me
Opened my keg of lager Beer -

[Printed: March  MONDAY 21  1859]
Looks like rain - children gone to Grandma Badgers to dine - I went to Ma for a little while
childrens dancing class met at Ben Adams
went to Tea at Ma's Mr. Badger also - rained when we came home
Mr. Frank Hood + wife also at Tea
Siss spent the day with Ma -

[Printed: March  TUESDAY 22  1859]
Threatens to rain - went at ten O clock to Ma's to say "Good Bye" to Mrs. Frank Hood - took children with me - Omhirlus? at the door on their way to ?
Mrs. Powell spent an hour with me - Mrs. Hilton called also
went to dancing school with children - Mr. Badger to Gymnasium
cut out childrens Berges?

[Printed: March  WEDNESDAY 23  1859]
Pleasant + warm - but damp
Called to see Siss - Mrs. Roger there - eat Bread Crackers + tongue with her children with me took them down town to get slippers for Wastell party - Mr. Anderson gave Eva + Belle pretty Pietunes?
returned home + prepared children for Party - took Dora Coleman with me 
rode there + back - spent a pleasant evening - children danced a number of dances - no failune?

[Printed: March  THURSDAY 24  1859]
bright + Sunny but damp
dancing school at Mrs. Adams
Mrs. Breckenridge called to see me also Miss Bliss who wants the children to come to her school
went to my dress maker Mrs. Murphy at 5 with V + Siss in Carriage
Mr. B at Gymnasium
my baby is the plainest child I ever had - he has fair skin blue eyes light Hair - he daily improves he looks same like Belle - he is the most wakeful child I ever had - both day + night -

[Printed: March  FRIDAY 25  1859]
Cold + cloudy - children out walking - Siss spent 2 hours with me - children went to dine with her
Mrs. Ben Adams returned home last night - sent me Orange Bannanas and Guava Jelly - Siss sent me nice peaches
Mr. Badger at home
my baby - to night covered with eruptions - also bad Cough - Mr. B still cutting out Doll furniture for children - Mr Whipple did not come to give children Singing lessons

[Printed: March  SATURDAY 26  1859]
beautiful but windy
children gone to Mrs. Adams to a little Party - Mrs. Badger + Mrs. Cutts called to see me - Baby all thickly broke out with an eruption also a hard cough + Fever
don't know weather it is measles or not sent for Dr. Rogers but he did not come - went to dancing school with all the children  
they danced their dance O'er the Summer Sea - returned home and talked with Mrs. Adams awhile
gave Ella a new chintz dress 80cts a yrd - Mr. B, at Gymnasium
brought children Chintz dresses -

[Printed: March  SUNDAY 27  1859]
Cloudy + windy - Mr. B. down town children gone to buy Gum drops
Mr. Badger + children gone to his church, I to my church - in Afternoon children gone to see Aunt Belle - Mr B gone to see his Sister + Mother - I went and took tea with Ma
met Mr. Shreve + Siss there - After tea went to Mr Haywoods church - heard a charming lecture on the word Hell - large company present - my family all well

[Printed: March  MONDAY 28  1859]
Cloudy + damp - children in the garden playing
Siss called to see me
made Belle a present of a beautiful sun shade
sky blue) Virginia called to take me to ride but I stayed home to be with Mr Badger who was going to sew on the Sewing Machine
Mr. Badger after Tea went to a meeting at Baptist Church to try and build a House of refuge - Mrs. Charles Luns borrowed childrens dresses - x / Mary Tyler had a Son this morning

[Printed: March  TUESDAY 29  1859]
Cold + gloomy - children out playing - went to Mrs. Murphy to have my dress fit took Belle + Eva with me
called and dined with Sister Belle - returned home and went riding with Virginia - bought fringe for childrens Beige dresses - + flowers
bought Mattie a little Fan - Mr Badger gone to Gymnasium - Belle sick to night with Headache + sick stomach
all of my girls more beautiful from babies to four years -

[Printed: March  WEDNESDAY 30  1859]
Clear but cold - Eva + I went to V's to Singing class - children doing well but would do better if they knew how to read - Belle unwell with Headache + sick stomach
went shopping with V + Siss - went with Mr. B - Virginia + David in Carriage to Concert of Karl Formel Madame Labrade + Miss Fotensal? - much pleased. Belle from 3 months to four years was one of the most beautiful children I ever saw - very fair skin blue eyes - Brown curls + ? feet? - everywhere admired

[Printed: March  THURSDAY 31  1859]
Sunny + warm - children out walking - Belle well
bought needles from a man - children dancing school meets at Mr. Hunts
finished childrens Pink Berege's? to day - Hiltons children called to see me I walked out with Ada - then went to see Ma - Siss + Mr. Shreve are taking supper with me also David - Siss quite well
Mr Badger disappointed is going to Gymnasium
gone to his Fathers to play quortz -

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 1  1859]
Pretty day children out walking - I went to Siss at 4 O clock and stayed untill 5 - she had regular pains from 2 in the day 
sent for Mrs Roger at seven in evening - Doctor Rogers at 11 at night
Ma + V at 3 in morning and baby not yet born - I went to see Miss Bliss and then took a walk
Ma is going to stay all saturday with Siss - My Eva was and is still beautiful - childish in manner + lovely in disposition

Baby Mattie Belle Shreve born -
[Printed: April  Saturday 2  1859]
Mr Badger at Gymnasium
Raining very hard - up at 5 O clock - sent for to go down to Siss - went in V's Carriage
baby 1 minute old when I got in the house , -
lovely large fat baby
Sister Belle very ill suffering with after pains although it is her first child - stayed untill 10'O clock, had been home an hour when I was sent for again - She had a faint spell - had a number of them in two hours - Mary returned from Grandmas? at nine - Ella at lunch with me?

[Printed: April  SUNDAY 3  1859]
Sunny + Cool - took breakfast a ten
Mr B at eleven - Mr B and Belle went to morning church
I went to see Siss in Afternoon took Eva and Mr B. with found Siss complaining wrote to Mrs Hackney - called to see Mrs. Badger with children - went to night church heard a nice lecture from [blank space] after church called to see Siss found her better -

[Printed: April  MONDAY 4  1859]
Looks like rain - going to see Siss, dancing school meets at goodye? Nicholas
went to see Siss at one O clock took children with me
stayed untill half past two - comber her Hair for her
she had a large quantity of milk - tender nipples, baby fat + well - Anna Burbridge ill - had a lend? born Babe
Eva not well to night
Ada with a bad cold

[Printed: April  TUESDAY 5  1859]
Looks like rain - very cold - children at home - went to see Siss found her very complaining - Mr B at Gymnasium - girls gone to a Candy pulling - - Ada my smoothest child takes a great deal of care of herself - very independent speaks well and distinctly walks + runs beautifully
very much admired + loved by large + small - she is very pretty - very fair large dark blue eyes and brown curls - beautiful form
she is 14 months old - knows almost everything

[Printed: April  WEDNESDAY 6  1859]
Went to V's House with Belle to [word crossed out] singing school - then went to see Siss 
found her very ill sent immediately for Dr. Rogers + Mr Shreve - she has been ill all day under the influence of Chloroform + Morphine - Mr Paine supped with me went at ten O clock at night to see Siss stayed untill half past Eleven
left her ill very ill
Anna Burbridge still ill -

[Printed: April  THURSDAY 7  1859]
Beautiful Spring Morning
went to Siss house a nine O clock - found her no better - Siss very sick - Anna Burbridge dead - died a eight in morning Mrs. Angela Gray called to see me also Mrs. Brant Mrs. Small - Siss ill all day - doctor Burgers given morphine
called to see her at ten O clock at night - no change for better

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 8  1859]
Cloudy + cold- Siss a little better - Anna Burbridge to be buried at 11 - Eva has a bad attack of croup
Belle + Ada with bad colds - Siss very ill - pains every 12 hours - baby doing well
Mrs. Badger + Aunt Lizzie took lunch with me

[Printed: April  SATURDAY 9  1859]
Sprinkling + cold - went at ten O clock to see Siss found her a little better
Eva with a very bad Croup + children with bad colds made their swiss flannel dresses
about 2 O clock Virginia sent (at night - for Ma + me Siss was worse - we hurried down and found her in a Sorry Sp-? stayed two hours and then returned home - we were very much alarmed -

[Printed: April  SUNDAY 10  1859]
beautiful + clear. children all at home - I went to see Siss at 12 O clock
found her the same - quite ill - stayed with her untill 4 O clock - she had a Spasm at 2 O clock which lasted 20 minutes - stayed untill 9' O clock at night - Virginia took my place and stayed all night - Siss had 3 spasms before morning - -

[Printed: April  MONDAY 11  1859]
very warm + pleasant - went to Siss's house at 11 O clock
took baby + Ellen with me - in Virginia Carriage found Siss a little better (a very little) stayed all day with her - baby took colic and was very uncomfortable for two hours
Siss had a Spasm at half past one after sleeping an hour she has very sore nipples - looks miserably - every body inquiring about her
came home at night - Virginia took my place - went back at nine O clock found her not so well - very weak
doctor there - baby well
my children better, at house with Jerlin? my sewing girl -

[Printed: April  TUESDAY 12  1859]
April shower with rain 
Siss no better or worse. some hail this morning
going to Siss house with Ada baby + Ellen
Stayed with Siss all day she had a spasm at half past two after waking up, slept 2 1/2 hours rained all day Ma came in the evening to see Siss
I stayed all night
Severe storms in the night
Siss slept all night but very restless
I went from her room to my room several times
nursed her baby 3 times

[Printed: April  WEDNESDAY 13  1859]
Very bright but cool
Mr. Badger called to see me this morning
Dr. Rogers called also - Siss better no spasms in the night - breasts still very sore - hair not combed yet - dreadfully entangled
Mrs. Horn - Pope - Miss Ella Pope - Mrs. Charles Ripley - Mrs. Kendry Carter - - Miss Douglass returned from Siss for a little while

[Printed: April  THURSDAY 14  1859]
Dancing school meets at Mrs. Hunts - Siss a little better - Clear weather but cool - returned home untill evening - will then go and stay all night with Siss, take baby with me - children out walking - Mrs. Robert Tyler's Roberta Cora + little Robert called to see me - My new silk dress came home from Mrs. Murphy's - Ma to night with sick Headache - Mr. Badger gone to church with David at Unitarian Church -

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 15  1859]
Siss's baby 13 days old - with Siss to day - Siss Page called to see me just finished my dinner - Siss better but not able to sit up yet - baby asleep in Mr Shreves front room - with Ellen
Stayed all night with Siss - slept in Siss room on Sofa - nursed Siss baby and mine too
nursed mine in the night - Siss Slept all night - so did her baby - and Mrs. Roger

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 15  1859]
Cold and looks like rain - dont feel bright this morning - did not get much sleep - waiting for Virginia to come before I go home - intend to comb Siss hair this morning first time for two weeks dreadfully entangled - finished childrens Cambric tucked dresses - going to nurse Siss's baby at ten O - clock to night - Belle + Eva taken warm merh?
Mr. Badger at Gymnasium
Virginia going to stay to night with Siss -

[Printed: April  SUNDAY 17  1859]
Snowing at Eleven'O clock
Brother Joe arrived this morning also Rhoda + Mattie - Siss better
Mr. Badger + Belle gone to church - I am going to Siss house - - my children all well - Virginia at Siss's waiting for me - went to Siss at 12 O clock stayed with her untill 3 then came home nursed baby and returned back again 
Brother Joe + family arrived this morning - children out walking - went to Church with Mr. Badger no one staying with Siss to night but nurse + family

Mattie S. had a fall,
[Printed: April  MONDAY 18  1859]
Went to see Siss at half past ten - beautiful clear morning - Virginia then left I remained untill half past one combing Siss hair all the time she convalesing  slowly - went to see Rhoda? at one - found her with a sick hand from bone fellon - Mattie recieved a fall over a stool and complained of her side. is cocked from it
children went to dancing school at Mrs. Adams
Mr Badger at some meeting of service - Mrs. Rawson called

[Printed: April  TUESDAY 19  1859]
beautiful + warm - went to Siss's at half past nine + stayed untill one she not quite so well - spent a bad night - combed a small piece of Hair - may brought in some Candy E. Vemon brought her 
sent children to Louisville Hotel to see Rhoda - Dr. Flint says she has curvature of spine. I went shopping bought Siss's baby a gold ring - went to see her at 6 O clock found Joe + Virginia there - Mr B at Gymnasium -

[Printed: April  WEDNESDAY 20  1859]
went to see Siss at 11'O clock stayed untill half past two all the time combing her hair - Rhoda + Mattie called to see Siss - I sent Siss 2 squrts some Custard + Stock
Eva gave her baby a pair of cuff pins - I went Shopping all Afternoon bought Brown Hats, also sleeve buttons for Octavius he twenty one to day - Mrs. Hilton 24 to day - Mattie Shrivdon? fell down our back stairs
my baby not well - siss a little better - cant sit up yet

[Printed: April  THURSDAY 21  1859]
Raining + cloudy - children gone to Adams to dancing school - pouring rain
made childrens swiss tucked dresses - went to see Siss at six'O clock - found her very sick with severe Headache and general Neuralgia - went to church to hear Mr. Harrington on the crucifix soon - took Belle with me - Siss's baby well - Severe Rain when at church + lightening

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 22  1859]
Raining + very damp -  went to Siss at half past ten - stayed untill 12 - found her better - but farther? found Pa then - Pa and I went to Louisville Hotel to see Rhoda saw her Mattie + Brother + Mrs. Hite
returned home in rain got very wet at one O clock - gave Richard Phebe 50 05. Mr Badger at home to night
Eva's Hair curls very pretty half a yard long Ada's also, curls about 3 inches long

[Printed: April  SATURDAY 23  1859]
Beautiful + Sunny  - went to see Siss at 11 'O clock stayed untill one - found Virginia + children there
went Shopping before going to Siss's - bought Adelaide siss black girl a purple calico dress as a present - at three O clock went to dancing school with children in green flannel silks - took Don Coleman - Mattie Sheridan + Adams and Hunts with us - Mattie spent the day with me - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - Brother called - Baby brother, + bowels very much out of order

[Printed: April  SUNDAY 24  1859]
Beautiful balmy morning
Mr. Badger gone to Church
I went to Siss stayed untill 2 'O clock - found her better but not sitting up yet
baby well and dressed up nicely - had a very nice dinner to day - went to Grandma Badger's in the Afternoon took all the children with me returned home and went to see Siss
found Mrs. L. Shreve there, the first visitor she has seen - then went to hear Mrs. Harington at Mr. Haywards church -

Mrs. Brents baby born to day.
[Printed: April  MONDAY 25  1859]
Beautiful Morning - went to see Siss at 11 - took Ada with me found her better
May Shreve going at 2 O clock to Georgetown - Mattie S spending the day with us she is very much crooked on one side - dancing school meets at our house to day - Mr. Wastall bringing? the children the Hearken? 
Mr. Badger at home to night Mrs. Brents baby born this morning at nine O clock - India leaves to day been with me 6 weeks - gone to Bunbridges -

Mrs. Shreve sitting up to day -
[Printed: April  TUESDAY 26  1859]
Threatens rain, went Shopping at three O clock - took umbrella with me - also children bought for myself a pair of Cuff Pins cost $4,00 - also bought baby

a sun bonnet also one for siss's baby - Dr. Holloway just arrived spent the evening with Ma - to Tea 

Mr. Badger went to Gymnasium - caught in dreadful storm - went to see Siss - found her sitting up for first time - Brother gone to Indiana Rhoda at the National - Commenced rubbing my throat with liniment

[Printed: April  WEDNESDAY 27  1859]
Looks like rain - Mattie S came to spend day with me children gone to Aunt Belle's to see baby bathed - I also went and stayed an hour
Siss not well has a Headache - Dr. Holloway dines with me at 2'O clock also Pa Mr Badger + David
children gone to carry Aunt Belle some custard - brought Belle a large Brogan Hat - Mr. Badger at home
sons of Mattie to parade at 12'O clock to night with Mavic? - went to see Mrs. Brent found her very unwell - l.

[Printed: April  THURSDAY 28  1859]
Looks like rain - dancing school to meet here at 3'O clock - bought a straw bonnet for myself cost [blank spot]
children going out to walk - Mr. Wastell gone out in the country so he did not come
Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - I went to see Siss and stayed 3 hours with her found her better - she sat up an hour -

[Printed: April  FRIDAY 29  1859]
Raining and gloomy
Rhoda + Mattie spending the day with me - had a very nice dinner - Mr Badger home at 4 O clock - I have not had an opportunity to visit siss to day - children all at home - baby very well - Rev James Covik? called to see me - enjoyed his visit very much - baby went down to see Mr Craik first time ever in parlour - behaved well Siss married a year to day

[Printed: April  SATURDAY 30  1859]
Very pretty day - Breakfast at half past eight
went to Siss at ten stayed untill one. found her better but very weak - she sat up an hour - cant walk at all nor stand Dr Rogers called twice - went to Dancing school at 3-O clock - full house
children danced nicely dresses in blue silks. Mr Badger at Gymnasium
paid Julia 12 dollars for sewing -

[Printed: May  SUNDAY 1  1859]
To day is ushered in most beautifully very warm - Mr. Badger and Belle gone to church - I went to see Siss found her better sat up an hour - rolled her up to window to see people coming out of St Pauls church - children out walking Nurse gone to church - dining room girl with Ada consequently
I will have to nurse Mr. Badger asleep on bed near 5 O clock - baby Brother three months old to day

[Printed: May  MONDAY 2  1859]
Breakfast at nine - beautiful morning - but very warm - went shopping with children
bought myself a white Fan cost 2,00 bought Brother a dress and a number of other things Belle a gown shade?
went to see Siss - found her sitting up - not dress got in night dress
she made us ride home in Bret - dancing school met here
went to see Ma to night invited to Mrs. James Purdue? to woman? night - Kate Breckenridge had a Son to day

[Printed: May  TUESDAY 3  1859]
Beautiful day went to see Siss as usual
found her a little better - tried to get my white Shallie? made for Mrs. Purdue?'s party f but failed - Mr. Badger went also David
Ada has a very bad cold - had my silk dress washed and servant? made it up -
all the children well but Ada - Our new family table came home to day -

[Printed: May  WEDNESDAY 4  1859]
lovely day - but my servant? went to see Siss at 11-O clock returned and found Virginia + two children - Mattie Sheridan + Fanny Fuller all at our house - Mattie S. had two sick spells while here. they all left at 2 O clock - the circus came to town to day - my children crazy to go
I am going to Mrs. Adams to night will wear Puffed illusion - going to get V to fix my hair - children going to Mrs. Adams to dance before party

[Printed: May  THURSDAY 5  1859]
Today is like June so warm + sunny children gone to see Aunt Belle
I am going myself as soon as my silk dress is finished
Brother baby - myself + Ada went and came home at 3'O clock I dined with Mr Shreve - Miss Wastell did not come
children put on lace necks for first time
Mrs. Hackney returned called to see me
Mrs. Hite - Barrett + Mrs. Gautt? called to see me - Mattie Sheridan broke out to day with scarlet Fever
engaged myself at Adams

[Printed: May  FRIDAY 6  1859]
Exceedingly warm - but sunny - called on Mrs Ben - Adams - did not see her - called on Siss - found her sitting up - but very weak she improves very slowly
Ma staying with her baby well - Mattie Sheridan the same
went to Circus at 2 O clock with David + family - Mr. Badger gone to night and took with him his Father Ella Horace + Eddie my children enjoyed it
Blaird Smith dead - Ada's cold better -

[Printed: May  SATURDAY 7  1859]
The weather is still very warm but pleasant
Ada not well at all - Mattie Sheridan very sick
Blind Smith's funeral took place at 5-O clock - went to Shaw's galley took all the children and had their pictures taken
went in a Hack - and stayed untill near 3 O clock
got first rate pictures of the children and myself
whurrs? and went with children to dancing school then went to see Siss and returned at eight
Mr. Badger at home to night V. altering her home

[Printed: May  SUNDAY 8  1859]
Weather still very warm
went to christ church - took children with me, also Albert
Mr. Badger went to Mr. Haywood's - severe rain + Hail at 2'O clock sun came out brightly at 3 - went to see Siss found her in bed - not so well
saw Dr. Flint - he says Mattie is a little better with scarlet Fever
I am in dread of the children's taking it Ada still with bad cold baby Brother's likeness perfect - Went to Mr. Haywood's church to night

[Printed: May  MONDAY 9  1859]
Raining + very unpleasant
sent for Dr. Rogers to see Ada throat from bad cold inflammed - but he did not come - stayed at home all day for him
Mr. Hunt + family + Miss Rebuke gone East
Dancing school met at Mrs. Adams - my children went - it has been raining all day - Mr. Badger gone to church to night - I sewing - Mrs. Ruffner + family in the city - got a new pair of scissors

[Printed: May  TUESDAY 10  1859]
Sun Shining very bright but damp - went to see Siss at one'O clock found her better - comber her Hair - and got all the tangles out - Mr. Charles Pucker dined at Mr. Shreve's olive J? - returned home at three O clock - children went out to walk - Mattie S. a little better
Brother Joe in Lexington
got Margaret Mahan to make Brother 2 white bonnets - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium
Ada's cold better, Dr. Rogers came to see her -

[Printed: May  WEDNESDAY 11  1859]
Lovely morning - children out walking - with Ellen
Mrs. Carey called to see me - I went out to se Virginia gave Mattie ten cents - went a five O clock with Virginia to select a new carpet for her altered room
called to see how Siss was found her sitting up - pretty well - packed my new Cedar chest to day - it came home yesterday
Mr. Badger at house to night

[Printed: May  THURSDAY 12  1859]
To day is certainly lovely. my children are out walking - Ellen working so I have to nurse? trimmed childrens Longhorn Hats - children went to dancing school at Mrs. Adams - after school I went shopping and three of them with me - Mary has baby Brother on the parement? - Mr Badger gone to Gymnasium
have not heard from Siss to day - Rhoda with scarlet Fever took out to day herself -

[Printed: May  FRIDAY 13  1859]
Siss baby walked out to day
To day is as warm as June and except for a slight wind would be hot - my children have gone to Aunt Belle's to carry her baby a buff sewn? bonnet - Brother baby out walking too
I am going at 11 O clock to see Siss - did go and stayed an hour then went to see Mrs. James Forbes and Mrs. Hilton - came home at two and found Eva very sick - with high Fever
sent for Dr. Rogers - he thinks it may be scarlet Fever - cant tell yet

[Printed: May  SATURDAY 14  1859]
This is certainly a lovely morning - Belle has gone to see Aunt Belle - Dr. Rogers called to see Eva found her better, no sign of Fever or any trouble she is I think well
I think what made her sick was eating nuts
Mattie + Rhoda rode out to day - went to dancing school at 3 with Belle + Ada - after school visited Siss - she about the same gets on slowly not at all strong - expect Mary to night - Mrs. Drivers called to see me - children all well to night

[Printed: May  SUNDAY 15  1859]
Again the weather is most charming - Brother Joe returned from Danville this morning called to see us - for a few minutes
Rhoda went to church I went with Mr. Badger + Belle to Haywoods to hear the funeral of Blind Smith
Mr. Badger family at supper with me also Pa
children in garden playing
went to church at night and also to Siss house a little while - found her a little better - my children all well 
Mrs. Badger and Mrs. Cutts called before going to church,

[Printed: May  MONDAY 16  1859]
Mrs. Mitchell called to see me
It looks very much like rain - I intend going down street with children did or at 11 O clock - got caught in a rain 
Virginia took us home in her Carriage - children gone to Mr. Adams to dancing school - I went to see Siss found her better - Ma still with her
she not out of her room yet - went to Dr. Powell's faith? Albert to see the girls - - children all in health - water pipes laid in walnut street to day for water works first time in Louisville

[Printed: May  TUESDAY 17  1859]
This is a cheerless looking morning - I think it will clear off - cleaning up house to day - my children all well, Rhoda + Mattie gone to Estill Springs - Brother here - I went shopping this afternoon - bought myself a pair of net mits point lace collar, and travelling dress - to night went to see Mrs. Adams
Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - Siss went to ride to day for first time - she is better
She rode to Wilsons garden with Virginia
Commenced family Prayers to night

[Printed: May  WEDNESDAY 18  1859]
This is again a pretty day - I am busy this morning cutting out my new dress
children gone to Aunt Belle's house - going with all the children to Siss's to dine returned home at four O clock - threatens rain 
does rain now hard intended taken children to monkey show but it rains too hard - Mr Badger gone to his Sisters
Siss not so well to day cannot ride out for rain - bought Brother a new dress -

[Printed: May  THURSDAY 19  1859]
It rained all night - but the sun shines brightly this morning - I sent the children to Aunt Belle's house - I went to see Virginia - she has her home fixed beautifully - Belle + Ada took a ride in Mr. Barton's buggy - I went shopping - to get trimming for my Galmn? - Mr. Badger at Gymnasium - Mrs. Steeles colored woman fell down stairs and killed herself - this morning
Mrs. Mc Mullen's Danny has St Vitus dance

[Printed: May  FRIDAY 20  1859]
Again a lovely day - my little ones in health and playing in Garden - Brother baby gone to Aunt Belle 
cleaning house - I made my travelling dress to day went to see Siss, found her not well - but fixing some things to come a spend a few days with Ma. Mr. Badger gone riding to to Water works - Mr. Badger at home to night -

[Printed: May  SATURDAY 21  1859]
The weather is still lovely a clear cool breeze to day - went to see Siss with baby a ten O clock - found her about the same her baby well - she is at Ma's house - - went to dancing school this Afternoon with a host of children - my three and servant 3 Adams Dora Coleman + Annie Hirst - spent a pleasant Afternoon Mr Badger gone to Gymnasium
my children all well
Mr. Hirst expected home to morrow

[Printed: May  SUNDAY 22  1859]
To day is most glorious, a lovely wind is stirring - I am going to Christ church
Mr. Badger + Belle gone to Unitarian Church - children all well - Siss sent her baby to see us to day - she is a lovely Babe - dark blue eyes - and fat - but not very large - Siss not well to day - she is improving very slowly - still very weak - went to Mr. Haywoods church engaged the sermon his wife gave me a lovely Banquet went to Mrs. Badgers with children - it was cool to night

[Printed: May  MONDAY 23  1859]
The weather still fair but warm - after attending to family matters - went visiting - called on Mrs. A.D. Hunt - saw her. on Mary Shreve not well did not see her - on Leights - Mr. L quite sick did not se them - on Mrs. Ruffner visiting Bridgefunds - saw them all - on Lon McCluin Lon Tompson) saw them returned home sent children to Judge Nicholas, dancing school - visited? untill Ellen returned - sent children out to walk late - after Tea called with Albert to see Powells also Siss

[Printed: May  TUESDAY 24  1859]
To day quite warm, and Sunny - after attending family duties - went visiting untill 2 - called on Mrs. Tyler - not home - Mrs. Hatt sick Mrs. Rawsom + Moody saw them - Miss Douglas did not see - Mrs. Tom Martin did not see - Mrs. Joe Morris did not see Jenny Mrs. Joe Morris saw
children going to walk
commenced making a new dress - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - Minnie Wilder called to see
children called to see Siss

[Printed: May  WEDNESDAY 25  1859]
Day still beautiful - children all well - out walking - Mr. Whipple expected het did not come - Mr. Badger full of building house has several lots in new but not decided yet - Mr. Hunt gone 
Mr. Badger a handsome pair of Studs with diamonds in them - went to see Siss - she is still very poorly - just crawling about still at Ma's house
Mr. Badger at home
Brother has a new cap -

[Printed: May  THURSDAY 26  1859]
Very warm to day - I think our warmest day - children all well
went to Judy Michels to dancing school - but Mrs Wastell did not come - trimmed childrens Shakers with dark green - Ada with blue
Ada has no eye or stomach teeth yet - 2 years and 4 months old - Brother went short slums first time to day - we all went to get Ice Cream to day - Mr. Badger at Gymnasium -

[Printed: May  Friday 27  1859]
Quite Cold - and chilly - Ada out walking + all the children - trimmed childrens Legher?
Mr. Shreve called and took us all out riding found it quite cold - had to wrap children up in Shawls - went to Mr. Shreves clover field - found a birds nest with 4 eggs in it returned home and did not go out

[Printed: May  SATURDAY 28  1859]
Beautiful day - children gone to dancing school to practice for Wastell's party - in Afternoon went myself with Dora Duffields children and my own to Dancing school also Ada with little Ellen
returned home went to see Siss and stayed an hour - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium
the Organ man playing at Adams - her children out in Country - Mr. Atkinson house robbed at 2 O clock sunday the 29 - morning

[Printed: May  SUNDAY 29  1859]
To day is charming - went to Mr. Haywoods church with children heard a delightful sermon on Charity
expect Mr. Badgers family here to Tea
Walked to Mrs. Hiltons with all the children 
Mr. Badger called to see Mr. Warren Newcomb - with Belle + Eva - went to night Church, heard a sweet sermon on our Heavenly Home - Mrs. Badger told me something startling on Sarah -

[Printed: May  MONDAY 30  1859]
Raining and damp
going shopping with Virginia + Siss - children all well - dancing school met here to day - there was a mistake and dancing school met at Mr. Hunts - Mr. Badger at home to night Siss still very poorly - gains strength slowly - her Babe quite well - Siss will Ma on third street - Mr. Shreve at his house but he spends a great deal of time with her

[Printed: May  TUESDAY 31  1859]
It looks gloomy + cloudy this morning at ten O clock Ella Wolf called to invite the children to her Brothers Party on to morrow evening - Siss's baby also her first Party invited
I spent an hour with Siss this morning - she + I making new walking dresses - also new Swiss Tenie's?
Mr. Badger at Gymnasium to night I at home 
children will wear this swiss to Party
children all well had rest walking

[Printed: June  WEDNESDAY 1  1859]
Beautiful morning - but very hot - while sitting at Breakfast Virginia sent for me to come and Ma who was taken very sick - found her ill - she thinks from painting house - the smell - stayed an hour returned home found Mr. Whipple here
Mrs. Southall called also Mrs. Haywood + Mother Lou Thompson and Sisters - spent Afternoon with Ma
children went to Wolfs party at seven in Swiss Mr B. at Home

[Printed: June  THURSDAY 2  1859]
To day is very warm
After Breakfast went to see Ma washed Siss's baby for her
Ma very sick - at 12 O clock sent for a Hack and visited untill half past two called Mrs. on Mury - Johnson + Mrs. Dr Johnson did not see them on Mrs. Dr Bush, Mrs. R Ward saw neither of them saw Sarah Gray - called on Mrs. Dr Marshall did not see her. on Mrs. Watson saw them Mrs. Duvall Mrs. Gen Merriweather Dancing school at Hunts -

[Printed: June  FRIDAY 3  1859]
Dr. Caldwell attending Ma
To day is still warm
Mildred Ewing + Mother called on me also Mary Tyler - went to see Ma she still very sick with violent pain in side back + stomach - with high Fever - had a blister put on her side - beside innumerable other remedy
Siss went back home to night baby + all - she not well - Mr. Whipple gone
children lesson in singing 
May Diamond spent day with us - Mrs. John White twins spent Afternoon
children went to Hall to practice

[Printed: June  SATURDAY 4  1859]
It is very cold - went to see Ma at seven O clock before Breakfast found her no better - very ill
returned to Breakfast and fixed children for Dancing school at nine O clock and they stayed untill one 
I spent the day with Ma - her pains very severe - she taking Morphine - Mrs. Manning? went to Siss to Nurse her baby this morning - Mr. Badger at Gymnasium
children did not go to Dancing this Afternoon but went to Grandma Badger's

[Printed: June  SUNDAY 5  1859]
This morning is lovely - neither too warm or cold - after Breakfast went to see Ma - Nancy stayed all night with her - found her no better stayed with her untill one - Mr. B went to church to hear Mr. Bush - came home to dinner had severe Headache vomited and got better - returned to Ma stayed untill 4 - then went to see Siss she not strong yet
Mrs. Manning with her - stayed with all night took baby over there at 12 at night
she my? sick all night -

[Printed: June  MONDAY 6  1859]
Ma so sick at nine Sunday night ? had to call Dr. Rogers with Caldwell - this morning is very warm
returned from Ma's at half past seven - went to Bed very fatigued sitting up all night - and slept untill ten O clock
got up Breakfast and dressed baby + children
sent them out and went in parlour to see Mrs. Robert Taylor - then went to see Ma stayed an hour and came home to dinner Ma a little better spent the Afternoon with her untill 12 at night, Nancy stay all night -

[Printed: June  TUESDAY 7  1859]
Very warm this morning - went to see Ma at eight saw Dr. Rogers + Caldwell they think her better she very weak this morning have made no preparations for Wastell's party yet - Something odd about little E - - went at 2 O clock to see Siss found her tolerable but her infant quite sick - with Fever + something like Flu - she very smeary?
Mr. Badger bought a lot to day on Gray Street to build - Ma better to night - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - going to see Ma before Bed time

[Printed: June  WEDNESDAY 8  1859]
Went to see Ma at nine it rained very fast - Ma a little better - but still using Morphine - children went to Mr B Office - Eva rode out with Mrs. Adams - Belle with Aunt Belle - she called to see Ma - for? Baby brother have not decided what to dress the children in yet
Ada cut her [eye crossed out] first stomach took to day
all the children well
Mr. Whipple gave a singing lesson to the children - their dancing lesson over for summer

[Printed: June  THURSDAY 9  1859]
To day is a very pretty day neither too warm or cool - went to see Ma at nine + stayed untill 11'O clock - think her a little better - children gone with Sissie to hear her reading Match - Went at 2'O clock to dancing school to practice for Ball - returned went and stayed with Ma 2 hours - went to see Siss After Dinner - stayed untill ten at night - Siss's baby quite unwell she also not well - Mrs. Manning still with her - she not pleased with her -

[Printed: June  FRIDAY 10  1859]
Very busy this morning fixing children for Ball
went to see Ma found her a little better - Siss baby quite sick
Ellen gone down town to buy Feathers - Ada got a bad fall struck her back on a stool - hurt her much finished childrens dresses - red Hats trimmed + skirts trimmed - with red - looked very pretty Virginia took us round to Mr Wastell's and we walked home at ten O clock - they were a good many in character

[Printed: June  SATURDAY 11  1859]
Beautiful morning went at eight O clock to see Gray street lot - went to see Ma at ten found her not so well had a bad night worse night for a [feel crossed out] long time - went at three O clock to Dancing school at Hall - Mr. Wastell has a sick child about six months old - baby 
sallie Carter called to see the children also Tom Hunts children - went a five to see Siss she went riding and I stayed with her baby - it better 
I then went to see Ma at Ten at night

[Printed: June  SUNDAY 12  1859]
Today is beautiful weather warm
went to church with children + Mr. Badger after dinner went to see Ma found her better - Mr. Russell preached at Mr. Haywoods church - Old Mr. Badger took Tea with us - Ada was bidding him Good Bye at the steps when she fell down the first flight of stairs - and hurt herself on the head - it has lightening severely and poured rain - Brother is in Memphis - Nancy is sick to night Siss's baby is better - Mr. Wastell's baby better

[Printed: June  MONDAY 13  1859]
It looks like rain - went to see Ma found her not at all well - quite sick with high Fever - and great oppression in her head - stayed nearly all day with her not better at six O clock - children all gone to Aunt Belle's baby and all - Mr. Badger called to see how Ma was - Siss's baby better - Ma so ill that we had to Dr. Rogers + Caldwell at ten O clock - trouble all in her head - Mr. Badger gone to call on Sallie Hunt -

[Printed: June  TUESDAY 14  1859]
went to see Ma this morning at eight, first went to see Davids lot - then Ma - found her no better - stayed with her untill 2 O clock in the night
Dr. thinks she has Nervous Fever - threatened rain at 3 O clock - children out walking - Mr. Badger going to Gymnasium 
all day with Ma came home twice to nurse baby - siss called to see Ma, she not at all well - not decided about lot yet - my little ones all well

[Printed: June  WEDNESDAY 15  1859]
To day is very sultry - went to Ma as soon as Breakfast was over stayed untill 2 O clock Ellen brought baby over to be nursed
Siss called in Bret. with baby + Mrs. Manning 
spent the morning with Ma - Ma a little better but still not out of danger - with high Fever
Virginia sick to day with dysentery + Headache - Ma sick very sick all night - did not sleep at all stayed untill one then came home and sent Nancy - she stayed all night 
Ma did not sleep at all

[Printed: June  THURSDAY 16  1859]
Beautiful morning, so pleasant 
went to see Ma at eight found her no better - ill all night . Virginia still sick stayed untill 2 O clock came home to dinner. Siss called
Mrs. Manning left her 
she only tolerable - my children at home all well going over to Ma again - Mrs. Bull called to say we might keep her home - Mr. A.D. Hunt + family gone away presently, Siss's baby stayed with us while she Mr. Shreve + Mr. Badger went to ride

June  FRIDAY 16  1859
Stayed with Ma untill 12 O clock- then Nancy took my place - (I moun? at night) then called on Ma this morning at eight - saw Drs. Rogers + Caldwell they think her better
Virginia out riding - Siss called to see Ma - children out walking - stayed with Ma almost all day - Mrs. Hackny called to see me - she going away
Ma seems? better to night Nancy going to stay with her - Mr. Badger at home -

June  SATURDAY 18  1859
Beautiful Bright morning
went to see Ma at eight O clock found her worse - had not slept at all, all night apparently in a stupor
Doctors ordered nothing but nourishment - my children all gone to Dancing school for the last Saturday of the Season - Siss called to see Ma with her baby then called to see me
Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium in Afternoon children all went out walking - I went to Ma's stayed with her untill 2 in morning - then Virginia took my place - Ma slept some at night and is little better

June  SUNDAY 19  1859
Lovely Morning although it rained all night went as usual to see Ma at eight
saw Doctors - they have ordered nothing but nourishment
she still very ill - quite prostrated have spent half the day with her and rest at home - children all out on pavement - Mr. Badger and Belle gone to Church - Mr. Badger going out this Afternoon - stayed with Ma untill 11 - then Nancy took balman? of night -

June  MONDAY 20  1859
Another pretty day - called on Ma at eight
saw Doctors they ordered nothing but nourishment
stayed awhile, Ma much better - has appetite to day - stayed part of Afternoon with her - she will be alone to night thinks she will need no one - Belle not well has pain in stomach - Baby not very well - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium - Siss called to see me
her baby out of order in bowels -

June  TUESDAY 21  1859
Lovely day went to see Ma as usual at eight found her a little better but had not slept - stayed awhile 
at 3 O clock helped move her in another room - and fixed hers
stayed with her untill nine - Mr Badger at home  - sent Baby to see Neighbors children all well to day - Mrs. Holt + Miss Wilson called to see me - Bessie + Ellen + BUsy Coleman gone to Errape? yesterday

June  WEDNESDAY 22  1859
To day is warm but very pleasant breeze - called to see Ma - she much better - stayed awhile
returned home and remained untill five
went again to see Ma and stayed with her untill Virginia came home
went to see her after supper - capt. Coleman sick - Mr. Duffield stuck a pin in his leg - Siss unwell to day - - - 
her black child has whooping cough - - 
Mr. Badger at home to night - children all well -

June  THURSDAY 23  1859
Beautiful day - visited Ma and found her better but no appetite - went down to Office with Belle + Eva returned at 3 - and went to see Ma found her not feeling well - Mrs. Leven Shreve + Mrs. Charles called to see me after a call made them 14 months before - Mrs Arch Cochran + Miss Cockran - spent Afternoon at home with Mr. Badger looking at his plan for house - children all gone to Aunt Livine just heard of May Taylors baby's death - Mr B. at Gymnasium

June  FRIDAY 24  1859
Mr Whipple did not come
Lovely morning - went to see Mary Tyler Johnson this morning at ten O clock - saw her baby in its Coffin - it died of Colera infection 4 days sick 
attended the Funeral at 2 with David + children - walked out to Gray street then Broadway home - went with V + Siss to see a little Mulatto for sale - went to see Ma she better but not out of Bed - Siss + baby called to see me - I went with children to see Mrs. Page - children called on Prathers and Haywoods + Fannie Hunt Mr B at home
my baby not very well -

June  SATURDAY 25  1859
To day is warm + lovely
went as usual to see Ma
she sat up for a little while children all at home - Ma not so well at night - bad Headache and sick stomach - Mr. Badger going to Gymnasium - - went to see Mrs. Hilton she gone out riding - children gone to see her and Eva bought a pair of shoes - Ada a pair of blue slippers -

June  SUNDAY 26  1859
To day is very warm - Mr. Badger and Belle going to Mr. Haywoods - I went to hear Mr. Craik - went to see Ma she a little better - went at four O clock - to see Siss she and her baby tolerable well - David was there - Mr. L. Badger + Octavius Badger supped with me - went after supper to Mr Haywoods church children out walking - baby ? of order still ? [ink seeping through page obfuscates text]

Mrs. Higgins nursed my three oldest children.
June  MONDAY 27  1859
To day is very hot - Belle + Eva gone to dentist to have their first upper teeth pulled out - I mean? Belle - went to see Ma she sitting up - better 
Mrs. Higgins from Cincinnati called to see me - she nursed my three first children - Mrs. Manning X Ada - Mrs. Hackney my boy - gave a dollar to Grace Church for a Picnic  - Mrs. Miles nursed my son Shreve (N?

June  TUESDAY 28  1859
Last night was the hottest night of the Season - so is to day - I went to see Ma - found her sitting up - Virginia came for me to ride - children saying? lessons to me both in readings Music + Dancing
having a plan of our house drawn - children gone walking with Miss Rebecca + Carrie - Siss called to see me - left her baby here - I went to get blonde for childrens Gipsy's - then went to see Siss - called also to see Ma she better - Mr. Badger at home - Belle had her first upper tooth pulled out by Mr. B
She seven years old and 9 months old.

June  WEDNESDAY 29  1859
To day is exceedingly warm
we nearly melted all night - Baby Brother with high Fever - and could not sleep - sent for Dr. Rogers at eight - he says it is the warm weather that troubles his head + bowels - he has slept all day - Mr. Whipple did not come to day - we have just had a nice shower
papers announce this morning the death of Victor Ward - at Helena Arkansas Flax - Carrie + Susy going this Afternoon out to Mr. Mallory's to stay - Siss called - Mr. B out

June  THURSDAY 30  1859
To day is another very hot day - baby better but still a great deal of hurt in his head - Making  Blank Gipsy's to day for the children - Mr. Badger gone to Gymnasium also to Mr. Shreves - Mrs. Powell + Mitty gone to Charleston?
Mr. Badgers plan for house completed to day
Siss out riding - 
Belle getting her first upper tooth - she 7 years old and 9-months

July  FRIDAY 1  1859
To day is quite warm
baby very unwell all night - went to Hesy? sale with V at ten O clock bought my baby some clothes
went with Siss at 11 to the same store then went to see Ma
she with Headache
Mr. Whipple came to day - bought some sewing silk - dressed and sat at the front door this Afternoon for first time Siss called in Carriage with baby - Mrs. Adams came over to see baby and stayed untill 9 - O clock
Mr B at home

July  SATURDAY 2  1859
To day is quite warm
Siss called to see me when we were at Breakfast
went over to see Ma at two O clock - found her not very well - went at five O clock to Victor Wards funeral with Siss + David - sat on front steps Belle + Eva went riding with Aunt Belle + Ada with Virginia - had a dress made? at 11'O clock - dont know who it was yet
my baby still not well all the other children are

July  SUNDAY 3  1859
Beautiful is to day - a charming breeze - went to church with Mr. Badger + children to Mr. Haywoods
baby with Fever and pains in bowels - went to Ma's in Afternoon with baby - children out walking
found Mrs. John Daily of Lexington there she going home in morning
Ma sick all night with Colera Moobos - went to night Church to hear Mr. Haywood prove that Unitarians were Evangelicals 
a full church - Ellen let the baby fall off the bed on the floor - very cold

July  MONDAY 4  1859
This morning is glorious quite cold - Mr. Badger has taken the children down town and bought them a lot of Candy - Cannon announced this morning the glorious fourth - innumerable Omnibuses have taken a number of persons on Pic'nic's 
to day my servants have all gone to a Pic'nic + Ella was here to Breakfast - we are invited to Ice. Cream at Father Badgers at three - baby better went with the 3 children to Grandpa's and spent a delightful Afternoon

July  TUESDAY 5  1859
After Tea on the fourth went to Ma's with children + Mr. Badger and engaged Mattie's Fire Works - about nine O clock went to Mr. Hiltons he had splendid Fire Works - had a nice supper - went into the parlor and saw children dance returned home
Ada had a long vomit and continued vomiting part of the night - about 3'O clcok Belle commenced vomiting and Eva's nose bleed, so we had a nice night of it - all the efforts of eating, Siss has called for me to ride - Mr. Badger at Gymnasium

July  WEDNESDAY 6  1859
To day is beautiful + cool - children went to Aunt Lucinia's baby better - Made children Blonde lace Hats - Mr. Whipple gave a lesson - also brought the old play- Ground - Belle gone riding with Siss - Ada gone down town - Eva at home - Brother Joe arrived to day - brought children a lot of Candy - Ma well but not strong - Brother Baby takes a great deal of notice at 3 + 4 months
he is very fair + light Hair blue eyes - Ada Brown Hair dark blue eyes, fair skin

July  THURSDAY 7  1859
To day is beautiful - warmer than yesterday
went to see Ma with Baby - she better, Brother Joe gone to Estill
went riding with Siss + children - got Cream at schathers? - Mr. Badger at home - Baby better - Belle commenced Freckelling at five years 
she has a very fair skin Eva not Freckled at six - Ada makes plays and dances at 2 years - Belle danced at three years Eva at five - all dance well
Belle + Eva commenced singing? at five + seven -

July  FRIDAY 8  1859
To day is warm + sunny
I went down town to make some purchases
called at John Arnolds saw him his brother William his Father Mrs. Wherdon all on a visit she going North William going South - children out to Grandma's Mr. Whipple called - but children not at home - had a sweet? night baby crying - Eva screaming with Head ache and Fever - I up all night
Brother very strong at 4 months stands on his feet holds his head straight

July  SATURDAY 9  1859
To day is warm with a pretty breeze - went to Ma's at ten found Siss spending the day with baby - Eva very unwell in bed
William Arnold called at five took all the children down to see him Eva better - Mr. Badger came home at six very sick in a Hack with Fever + dysentery
sent for  Dr. Rogers - Octavis David + Father Badger called to see Mr. Badger - stayed untill nine - Belle with dysentery too -

July  SUNDAY 10  1859
Another Sunny day - Mr Badger slept well all night from Hyoscimine he is better this morning
Dr. Rogers called and left him nothing to take Belle better - Eva well + baby - Octave Father Badger + Albert called this morning
Mr. Hunt + Miss? Hilton called this Afternoon - we commenced Home Catechism? - Eva just getting her first permanent she Six years + 4 months - Ada + Eva have very curly Hair Belle's curled untill she was three years, cut it off and spoiled it

July  MONDAY 11  1859
To day is a scorching day
I was up all night with Belle - she vomiting all the time - her Flux stopped too soon to day she is a little better but still vomiting - Mr. Badger and baby both well - but he did not go down to Office
Jim Garrin is to be buried this Afternoon at four
Belle has a bad pain in her side - also a high Fever giving her Ice sent for Dr. Rogers he thinks as we do - Siss called to see us - so did Father Badger Octave Albert + Mr. Hilton - also Pa -

July  TUESDAY 12  1859
Last night was intensely hot - I walked the floor with baby a number of times - he was so warm he could not sleep - Belle was very hot all night from Fever - I did not go to Bed untill three this morning - we had all night to feed? Belle on Ice - to day is very warm - I got up about eight O clock
Brother Joe came in caught me undressed with Mattie + Nurse from Estill - Mattie is very fat + hearty
Belle a little better to day - Rhoda came to see me Mattie all day

July  WEDNESDAY 13  1859
Last evening Mr. Badger went to Tea with Siss Joe + Rhoda - little Mattie very fat but cant walk but a few steps - with spine Desease - she is very smart + beautiful - Belle much better this morning - put up our Mosquito Bars last night nearly melted baby did not sleep all night from heat - I did not sleep untill 5 this morning
Brother + family called to see us, - I Pa + Siss went to the Boat with them it is very warm to day
Octave left last night for Boston -

July  Thursday 14  1859
Warm, Oh! how warm it is
baby still very unwell although not sick had a wretched night baby cried all night bathed his head a number of times did not get to sleep untill five O clock when Ellen came - all the other children well
went down to the front door and stayed all Afternoon - Mr. Stanhoffe? the Architect called to see Mr. Badger went After supper to see Ma found them all well 
Mr. Powell returned home
carrie Adams came from Country

July  FRIDAY 15  1859
This morning is a scorcher
took Breakfast at nine
up all night last night baby a little better - not sick enough to confine - but troubled in his bowels with Fever
made all the childrens muslin night Gowns
had a terrible rain + wind storm at three O clock threw down all over town a number of trees roofs and other damages - blew down our kitchen chimney - went riding with Siss + Mr. Badger baby better to night - Mr. Badger at home to night

July  SATURDAY 16  1859
What we will do this hot weather I dont know - the children are now all well
After Breakfast went to walk with Ella Badger from fourth to Brook on Broadway - from Gray to Mrs. Badgers then home from home to Office then to get Mead, home then went to Ma's diner with Siss + family - in Afternoon went to front door then went riding with Siss - After dark went to see Powels - baby slept better - but not at all well - Mr. Badger gone to Mr. Hunts -

July  SUNDAY 17  1859
What a scorching hot day
went to Christ Church with children - Mr Badger to Mr. Haywoods - all the children taking a nap - but poor me cannot sleep in the day
children all well today - in the Afternoon took all the children with me - returned home late had another hot night and a very restless baby
Mr. Badger at home to night -

July  MONDAY 18  1859
Siss called to see me this morning just after I got up - stayed untill eleven O clock
she is anxious? to go away if I will - I have not decided
baby not at all well Bowels distended to day
went to ride with Siss her baby Mr. Badger + Ada called and got Mead + Ice cream - Eva went riding in Buggy with Dr. Powell Mr. Badger at home

July  TUESDAY 19  1859
To day is not so hot as yesterday - Virginia called to coax me to go to Rye Beach - I have not decided but making preparations
went to see Ma after supper found them all well - they think of going Monday - my baby a little better - all the children well went to schultress? to get Ice Cream with children - baby and all - Mrs. Milton called on me to day -

July  WEDNESDAY 20  1859
Virginia called this morning for me to go down town with her + Siss - jumped out of Bed and went shopping untill one - bought a new blue + swiss dress - sent for Julia she out in country - Mrs. Wash Anderson called to see me - went riding in carriage with Siss Belle Mr. Badger + baby - After Tea went to Ma's met Siss Mr. Shreve all talking about going away - none decided yet - baby better - children all well - Mr. Christopher called -

July  THURSDAY 21  1859
I took Breakfast at nine this morning  - Belle went riding with Aunt Virginia - all the children well but Eva she complaining a little - appetite bad - getting ready for the Beach
Siss called this Afternoon Eva + Ada went riding with her - Kate Breckenridge called to see me - very hot + day still - but not as warm as we have had it
all of full of heat -

July  FRIDAY 22  1859
Siss called this morning to see me while I was in bed at eight O clock children all well 
weather a little cooler 
making preparations to get to the Sea Shore
Belle riding with V - making children new blue dresses for travelling     David paid Miss Margaret $15.50 to day for sewing
Harpers playing at Mrs. Adams
Mr. Badger at home
[pencil scribble across page]

July  SATURDAY 23  1859
Early this morning Jenny Julian? came, I put her right to work - went down town with Virginia Shopping untill one O clock - - cut out Panties for Ada
Mrs. Brenston made my blue brown? waist - in Afternoon went riding with Siss Mr. Badger + Ada got Mead - Mr. Badger after supper went to supper 
children all well think we will not go away - this summer
Belle has her two front teeth out - Ellen Muller sick in bed -

July  SUNDAY 24  1859
To day is very gloomy it rained all night and all to day - Belle + Eva gone to Aunt Belle to supper
Mr. Badger gone to Church - Father Badger Albert + David took supper with me -

July  MONDAY 25  1859
To day is beautiful + cool
went over to Virginia at nine then came home to work - Siss called to see me
went to see Mrs. A.D Hunt she came home to day - she not at home - then went and sat an hour with Mrs. Adams - went also to ride with all the children in V's carriage - then went to say Good,Bye to David he has gone to N. york digging the foundations of our house to day - took Mend? -

July  TUESDAY 26  1859
To day is exceedingly pleasant and cool - Mr. Goning? sent us some peaches
children all well - Neighboring children all at our house
Siss called for me to ride I went took Ada got caught in a sprinkle - went after supper to see Mrs. Hunt found Mrs. Breckenridge Paul Grons franger? Breckenridge Mr. + Mrs. Adams there
Ada rolled out of her crib - and hurt her foot so did Eva -

July  WEDNESDAY 27  1859
This morning was lovely + cool - Siss called for me to ride called on the Brothers - not at home - went down to Siss, then went shopping with her untill one
bought Belle a Gum Doll 1,65,cts - took Cream at Schattress - Kate + Ellen Powell came over and sat on the steps
Mr. Brent called to see me with her Baby - she has sewing Julia for a few days - I went to see Mr. Hilton after supper - Mr. Hiltons sick with Colera Morbus

July  THURSDAY 28  1859
